title: Erdős Problem #632

overview.problemStatement: A graph is (a,b)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">(a,b)(a,b)(a,b)-choosable if for any assignment of a list of a" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">aaa colours to each of its vertices there is a subset of b" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">bbb colours from each list such that the subsets of adjacent vertices are disjoint. If G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG is (a,b)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">(a,b)(a,b)(a,b)-choosable then G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG is (am,bm)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">(am,bm)(am,bm)(am,bm)-choosable for every integer m≥1" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">m≥1m≥1m\geq 1.
